byline.contributor: Julia Preston contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: Justice Department officials said they would not ask the Supreme Court for permission to carry out the president’s immigration program while a fight over presidential authority plays out in the lower courts.

headline.print_headline: Immigration Overhaul May Be in Limbo Until Late in Obama’s Term
headline.main: Immigration Overhaul May Be in Limbo Until Late in Obama’s Term

snippet: Justice Department officials said they would not ask the Supreme Court for permission to carry out the president’s immigration program while a fight over presidential authority plays out in the lower courts.
abstract: Pres Obama's immigration overhaul plan may remain in legal limbo until shortly before his term ends in 2017; Justice Dept says it will not ask Supreme Court for permission to carry out plan until matter is resolved in lower courts; situation diminishes likelihood of putting plan into effect until just before 2016 election.
